channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One central bank seems worried about U.S. tech valuations. It’s not the Fed.
item.description: The Bank of England says the risks of a sharp market correction have increased as stock-market valuations look stretched.

item.title: Inflation was eating me alive in retirement, so I went back to work. I’m now 66. Was I right?
item.description: “Be more concerned with outliving inflation than Social Security.”

item.title: Goldman Sachs on the one thing that could turn the rally into a bubble
item.description: Goldman Sachs strategists have taken a deep dive into current stock bubble worries for investors. They argue the puzzle pieces aren’t in place yet.

item.title: Is it kidnapping to put my mother ‘kicking and screaming’ into memory care without a conservatorship?
item.description: “She has never been willing to sign a power of attorney.”

item.title: I’m retiring at 63 with $1.5 million saved. Is 70/30 equities/bonds too risky?
item.description: “My spouse and I have a combined $5,500 in monthly Social Security payments and a $2,900-a-month pension.”
